meanings.definition: To leap up suddenly; spring up.
meanings.sent1: The cat upleaped onto the table to catch the toy.
meanings.sent2: The frog upleaped out of the pond and onto a lily pad.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel upleaped onto the bird feeder, surprising the birds.
meanings.sent4: The idea upleaped in her mind like a spark of inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The athlete upleaped over the hurdle with grace and agility.

meanings.sent1: The ball upleaped high into the air when it hit the ground.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit upleaped over the log in one swift motion.
meanings.sent3: The toast upleaped from the toaster, almost causing a breakfast disaster.
meanings.sent4: Her heart upleaped with joy when she saw her long-lost friend.
meanings.sent5: The flames upleaped from the campfire, casting a warm glow around the group.
